sentence.text: ﻿Case 4 is a male in his 20s born to Swiss unrelated parents.
The patient was born after 38 weeks of gestation with a weight of 3110 g, a length of 51 cm, and 36 cm HC.

Postnatally, hypotonia, a large fontanel of 4.5×4.5 cm, inguinal hernias, cryptorchidism, minimal postaxial soft tissue polydactyly of the left hand, a high, bulging forehead with a flat nasal root and a broad nose, hypertelorism, bilateral epicanthus, mildly down-slanting palpebral fissures, a short philtrum and narrow auditory canals were noted.
Neither thumbs nor toes were broad or otherwise abnormal.
A cerebral CT scan performed in 1983 was reported to show hypoplasia of the corpus callosum.
Psychomotor development was severely retarded with a walking age of 4 years and expressive speech limited to a few words.
Hypotonia persisted and was probably related to the development of severe scoliosis, which was operated on two times.
At the age of 26 years he still showed hypotonia, kyphoscoliosis, and hypotrophic muscles with a restricted walking distance of 1–2 km.
It was reported that he sometimes reacted with aggressive behaviour.
At that time, weight was 55 kg (3–10th centile), length was 160 cm (−2.3 SD; 3rd centile), and HC was 59 cm (75–90th centile).

He showed significant facial dysmorphism (figure 1D,E) with high broad forehead, long narrow face, short neck, laterally highly arched eyebrows, bilateral epicanthus, telecanthus with inner canthal distance of 4.5 cm (+4.3 SDS) and outer canthal distance of 9 cm (25–50th centile), broad flat nose, short philtrum, asymmetric ears with a right ear length of 7 cm (97th centile) and left ear length of 6 cm (25–50th centile), and retrognathia with a large chin.
He also showed fetal finger pads and hypoplastic nails of the fingers and toes.
Metabolic testing, microscopic karyotyping and high resolution molecular karyotyping using an Affymetrix Cytogenetics 2.7 array showed normal results.

Direct sequencing of KIF7 revealed the same mutations found in case 3 but with different parental origin: the intron 12 acceptor splice mutation c.2593-3C>G is inherited from his mother while the exon 15 nonsense mutation c.3001C>T, p.Gln1001X is inherited from his father.
